She says that if her business runs well, like has happened to other ladies that are already clients, she believes that besides helping her husband with the expenses she will be able to save money to begin construction on a home with conventional materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Leia e casada e mae de 2 filhos. O marido de Leia nao esta empregado. vive de pequenos expedientes para sustentar a sua familia. Por isso Leia decidiu entrar para o Programa de credito , para ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. Leia para alem de vender produtos alimenticios de primeira necessidade em sua casa, ela fabrica pao caseiro e vende. O emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o primeiro. Ela diz que se o negocio correr be tal e qual como tem acontecido com outras senhoras que ja sao clientes, ela pensa para alem de ajudar o marido nas despesas poupar dinheiro para iniciar a construccao de uma casa com material convencional.

loan.use: Purchase more food products for sale

loan.name: Almahmad

texts.ru:
Almahmad Subonkulovich M. lives in Yavan. He is 46 years old and married with six children. Almahmad has a specialized high school education in accounting. For a living he raises animals, and would like a loan in order to buy calves to fatten and sell. He has 15 years of experience in this business, and it is the only source of income for his family. In addition, the development of private livestock breeding contributes to the development of the entire livestock sector and helps maintain meat prices. Almahmad plans to repay his loan within three months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

. 46 , , 6 . - . . . . . 15 . . , . 3 .

loan.use: To buy calves

loan.name: Kasanja East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Madina L.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand her fish business. Madina is 33 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Madina makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and construct a house. Madina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Madina is joined in her small group by Eva T., Jane N., Harriet M., and Sarah L.. Eva T. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase more food warmers. Jane N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to expand business. Harriet M. operates a business of selling matooke and wants to add to the business. Sarah L. is currently in the business of selling old clothes and is requesting a loan to increase the stock of clothes.

loan.use: To boost fish selling business

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 48-year-old car mechanic. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and their child. This is the fourth time Mohamad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs U$ 1000 to help him buy the necessary material for his business. Mohamad is doing his best to support his family.

loan.use: To buy materials for his car repair business

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old single man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. Ali owns an accessories store. This is the second time Ali is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 1000 to help him buy new merchandise for his business.

loan.use: To buy new merchandise for his accessories store

loan.name: Muharram

texts.ru:
Muharram Asadovna M. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 45 and married with 5 children. Muharram has a high school education and raises animals for a living. She is applying for a loan to buy a milk cow in order to get fresh milk for her family and to sell. Muharram plans to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

. 45 , 5 . . . . . 12 .

loan.use: To buy a milk cow

loan.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 36-year-old mother of 3. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. Nadia has a small bakery in which she makes a kind of bread that is called 'saj'. Nadia needs a loan to buy the needed provisions to sustain and develop her business.

loan.use: To buy provisions for her little bakery

loan.name: Nilza Antonio

texts.pt:
Leia is single and the mother of 3 children. She lives alone with her children. Her children's father does not live with them because he has another family. Leia sells peanuts in bulk. Her business is running well. Two of Nilza's children are in school. The other child is not in school because he is not old enough yet. Nilza buys peanuts in one of the districts in the Province of Inhambane. She makes two trips to make her purchases. She spends around 3,000MT to travel and buy her goods.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Leia e solteira e mae de 3 filhos. Ela vive sozinha com os seus filhos. O Pai dos seus filhos nao vive com ela porque ele tem outra familia. Leia vende amendoim a grosso. O seu negocio esta a correr bem. Os dois filhos de Nilza estao a estudar. Oterceiro ainda nao estuda porque ainda nao tem idade. Nilza compra amendoim num dos distritos da Provincia de Inhambane. Ela viaja 2 vezes para la para a compra do amendoim. Ela gasta cerca de 3.000,00 Mts para a compra e transporte do amendoim.

loan.use: Purchase more peanuts to sell

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28-year-old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and their 2 children. Ali owns a grocery store. He needs a loan of US$ 1200 loan to buy merchandise for his business. Ali is doing his best to support his family.

loan.use: To buy merchandise to expand his little grocery business

loan.name: Ashurgul

texts.ru:
Ashurgul O. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 58 years old, married and has 11 children. Mrs. O. has a high school degree. For the last twenty years she has been raising cattle. Mrs. O. is planning to use the loan money to purchase a milk cow. She is going to sell the milk to local residents. This will provide local residents with a new source of fresh milk and fermented milk products. Mrs. O. is hoping to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian, by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

. 58 . 11 . . . 20 . , . . 12 .

loan.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loan.name: Kiryoowa Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Sarah is 40 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 20 and 25. Both of them do not go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a commercial house. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Bena N., Phiona N., Prossy N., and Sylvia N.. Bena N. has a business running a bar and wants to buy a fridge and more beer. Phiona N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal. Prossy N. operates a piggery business and wants to buy more pigs. Sylvia N. is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks.

loan.use: To boost charcoal business

loan.name: Pardahol

texts.ru:
Pardahol O. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 31 years old, married and has 7 children. Mrs. O. has a high school degree. For the last ten years she has been raising cattle. Mrs. O. is planning to use the loan money to purchase a milk cow. She is going to sell the milk to local residents as well as use it to feed her large family. The additional income from milk sales will help Pardahol support her children as well as provide local residents with a new source of fresh milk and milk products. Mrs. O. is hoping to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian, by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

. 31 , 7 . . . 10 . . . . . 12 .

loan.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 22-year-old taxi driver. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. Ali is planning to get engaged to be married. He needs a loan for the maintenance of his car so as to be able to sustain his business and pay for all his engagement expenses. This is the first time Hussein is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: to pay for the maintenance of his car

loan.name: Khodr

texts.en: Khodr is a 49-year-old father of 2. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Khodr sells vegetables. This is the third time he is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua because he is planning to develop his business by opening a store. Khodr is striving to support his family.

loan.use: To develop his business by opening a little store

loan.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar Artykovna T. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 33 years old and married with four children. She raises crops for a living and has ten years experience in this business. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting wheat. This business is the main source of income for her family and also helps supply the local markets with wheat and flour. She plans to repay her loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

. 33 , 4 . . 10 . . . . 12 .

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing wheat

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 55-year-old car mechanic. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his family. This is the third time Ali is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs US$ 1000 to help him buy the necessary materiA. to sustain his business so he can pay his children's tuition fees.

loan.use: To buy materials for his little auto repair business

loan.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 59-year-old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and their 3 children. This is the third time Ali is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 1000 to buy 'hubble bubbles' (hookahs, water pipe devices for smoking) to develop his little business. The generated revenues will help his son open up a furniture paint shop.

loan.use: To buy 'hubble bubbles' (hookahs) to expand his little business

loan.name: Kiryoowa Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Phida N.. She is currently in the business of poultry and is requesting a loan to buy poultry feeders and drinkers. Phida is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 1 child. Each week, Phida makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her child. Phida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more chicks and the loan was paid back on time.

Phida is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Hawa M., Annet G., and Joyce B.. Sarah N. has a poultry business and wants to buy chicken feed. Hawa M. is currently operating a business running a salon and wants a loan to buy more salon equipment. Annet G. operates a piggery business and wants to buy more piglets. Joyce B. is currently in the business of pig rearing and is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loan.use: To expand poultry business and increase profits

loan.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani T. is married with four children. She is 36-years-old and comes from the Mushin Area of Lagos State. Mrs.T. has been in business since 2003 selling soft drinks. Her loan request of $450 will be used to purchase additional inventory.

loan.use: To purchase additional soft drinks for resale

loan.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is a 38-year-old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and their 4 children. This is the first time Taleb is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

Taleb is in the transportation business. The loan will help him pay his vehicle's public registration plate. Taleb is doing his best to support his family.

loan.use: To help him pay his vehicle's public registration plate

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 25-year-old single man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. Mohamad sells mobile phones. This is the first time Mohamad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 1200 to buy new merchandise for his business.

loan.use: To buy new merchandise for his mobile phone business

loan.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 64-year-old mother of 3. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs.

Layla is a tailor. She works from home. This is the seventh time Layla is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the materials necessary to sustain and develop her business. The generated revenue will help her pay her daughter's university fees.

loan.use: To buy materials to develop her little business

loan.name: Kisanja Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifa N.. She is currently in the business of operating a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy food warmers. Hasifa is 47 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 2 children aged 18 and 19 and both do not go to school. Each week, Hasifa makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a commercial house. Hasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Lubanga N., Justine N., Janet B., and Jenifer Nabujjo. Lubanga N. has a business in selling matooke and wants to add more capital. Justine N. is currently operating a business in matooke selling and wants a loan to boost business. Janet B. operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to purchase more clothes for sale. Jenifer Nabujjo is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy a hair dryer and more salon equipment.

loan.use: To expand restaurant business

loan.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 23-year-old single man. He lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Hassan owns a barber shop. This is the first time Hassan is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 700 to help him renovate his place of business.

loan.use: To renovate his barber shop

loan.name: Mosbah

texts.en: Mosbah is a 63-year-old father. He works and lives with his wife and child in the Beirut suburbs. Mosbah sells water from a cistern. He needs a loan to help him repair the tank. This is the first time Mosbah is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. US$ 1200 will help him sustain his business.

loan.use: To repair their water tank

loan.name: Mosbah

texts.en: Mosbah is a 63 years old father. He works and lives with his wife and child in the Beirut suburbs. Mosbah sells water in a cistern. He needs a loan to help him repair the tank. This is the first time Mosbah is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. 1200$ will help him sustain his business.

loan.use: To repair the water tank

loan.name: Muytiatu

texts.en: Mutiatu O. is married with two children. She is 33-years-old and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2001 selling wine, juice and spirits.. Mrs. O. requests a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional inventory for resale.

loan.use: To purchase additional inventory of wine, juice and spirits for resale

loan.name: Mapatano B Group

texts.en:
Odetta T., age 39, is a widow and has two children (ages 18 and 15). She has a tailoring business which she started 7 years ago. The business is open from 7 am to 3 pm daily, and allows Odetta to earn a monthly profit of around US$34.

Odetta hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania in order to expand her tailoring business and to open a new food sales business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of fish, sarongs, cosmetics, table tops, and milk, and in running a bar.

In the picture, Odetta is the first one on the left.

loan.use: Expansion of a tailoring business and opening of a food sales business

loan.name: Namuwaya Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mariam J.. She is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Mariam is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Mariam makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand business. Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 800000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mariam is joined in her small group by Salama N., Hafisa Namugga, Jane N., and Hasifa M.. Salama N. has a business running a hotel and wants to buy more foodstuff. Hafisa Namugga is currently operating a business running a beauty salon and wants a loan to buy hair wigs. Jane N. operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to increase stock. Hasifa M. is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loan.use: To expand beauty salon business to boost it

loan.name: Miladinka

texts.en: Miladinka was born in 1968 and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job. They have two kids, 14 and 4 years old. Miladinka will use this loan in the amount of US$ 900 for barn and henhouse repairs and also for buying stones and cement. In this way she will expand their little business and increase their income. She thinks that she will then be able to ensure better life and education for her children.

loan.use: Buying building materials to repair their hen house and their barn

loan.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi O., 40-years-old, is a mother of two children and hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks wholesale and has been in business since 1990. Her loan request of $450 will be used to purchase additional inventory.

loan.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale

loan.name: Namuwaya West A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zaina Nangobi. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Zaina is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 2 children aged 6 and 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Zaina makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Zaina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zaina is joined in her small group by Scola N., Jane N., Farida N., and Zaina N.. Scola N. has a business selling soft drinks and wants to buy a fridge. Jane N. is currently operating a business selling matooke and wants a loan to purchase more matooke from villages. Farida N. operates a business running a bakery and wants to buy more baking ingredients. Zaina N. is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loan.use: To increase stock of capital in her shop

loan.name: Radmila

texts.en: Radmila is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and she has 3 children, from 6-10 years old. Her husband is employed and he can earn about US$ 500 monthly. They also do agriculture work and they want to buy a cow with this loan. In this way they will be able to produce milk products, reduce family expenses, and increase income because once a week they will sell milk products at the market.

loan.use: Buying a cow

loan.name: Njeru A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret M.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to add to her shoe business. Margret is 42 years old and is married. Her husband is a shop attendant. She has 5 children ranging from age 12 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to higher institutions of learning. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more stock to increase profits and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Sauda Z., Florence W., Florence K., and Alice T.. Sauda Z. has a business in spare parts sales and wants to add more capital to the business. Florence W. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to build and expand her restaurant. Florence K. operates a retail shop business and wants to expand to a wholesale business. Alice T. is currently in the business of poultry raising and is requesting a loan to order new chicks and buy poultry feeds.

loan.use: To expand and boost shoe business

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a mother of three. She is 43-years-old and hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1990 she has been in the business of reselling plastic containers. Mrs. A.'s loan request of $450 will enable her buy more plastic containers for resale.

loan.use: To purchase plastic containers for resale

loan.name: Njeru B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine M.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed. Justine is 36 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 9 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Justine makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a dairy farm business. Justine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy chicken feed and the loan was paid back on time.

Justine is joined in her small group by Ruth L., Goloba N., Aidah T., and Damalie K.. Ruth L. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs for sale. Goloba N. is currently operating a tailoring business and wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine. Aidah T. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more capital to the business. Damalie K. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loan.use: To expand poultry business and make more profits

loan.name: Jesusa's Group

texts.en:
Juana, Sorayda, and Jesusa are members of the La Kantuta community bank. Juana has been a member for two years, but Sorayda and Jesusa joined four months ago. In that time, they have learned how to run their businesses more efficiently. In addition, they have learned how to educate their children, show compassion, and improve their self-esteem.

Juana is 33 years old. She is a single mother and has a one-year-old son. Juana sells emoliente, a warm beverage made from a variety of traditional herbs. She has been working in one of the main markets of Ayacucho for the past three years.

Sorayda is twenty years old. She has a store where she sells food staples such as four, sugar, and oil. Sorayda began her business two years ago with a loan from her mother. Now she is preparing to start at the university where she plans to study tourism.

Jesusa is 30 years old. She lives with her partner and their two children. Jesusa travels to different markets around the region. She sells food staples at the markets and buys grains, which she later sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Juana, Sorayda, and Jesusa need loans of 400, 400, and 800 soles respectivley (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying sugar, seeds, herbs, rice, oil, milk, soap, barley, corn, and wheat.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Juana, Sorayda, and Jesusa plan to use their savings to buy a home, pay for their childrens education, and own their own store.

loan.use: Juana, Sorayda, and Jesusa need loans of 400, 400, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in sugar, seeds, herbs, rice, oil, milk, soap, barley, corn, and wheat.

loan.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O., 40-years-old, has two children and lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She owns a food market and has been in business since 2004. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to increase her inventory of food products.

loan.use: To purchase food products for resale

loan.name: Amarilis Del Carmen

texts.en:
Amarilis has been a member of the La Kantuta community bank for two years. In the community bank, she has learned how to avoid sickness, the importance of punctuality and responsibility, and, above all, to save. Amarilis mentioned that she enjoys the bank meetings, particularly sharing ideas, experiences, and conversation.

Amarilis is 30 years old. She is married and has a two-year-old son. By profession, Amarilis is a teacher, but she currently sells clothing to friends and family. For the past two years, she has been traveling to the cities of Lima and Puno to buy the clothing, which she then sells in Ayacucho. In addition, Amarilis manages phone booths located in several areas around the city. She has had this business for eight months. She is also planning to open a chicken restaurant in a rented building near her home.

Amarilis needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy an oven, decorations, and tablecloths.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Amarilis plans to use her savings to build her home. Her dream is to own a home, establish her businesses, have stability, and to raise her son with as much love as possible.

loan.use: Amarilis needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy an oven, decorations, and tablecloths.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Gesusa

texts.es:
Gesusa A. lives, along with her husband (Mr. Modesto Cori) and five children, in her own home in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Gesusa has a sales stand in the Strongest market in the Cotahuma zone, and her husband works in construction. The loan being solicited would be earmarked for building a dormitory for her children. This is the fourth time she seeks credit, and a socioeconomic analysis indicates that she is a favorable candidate for a loan. She has been a client of ours since 2005, and her previous loans were repaid under the established terms.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Gesusa A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el seor Modesto Cori y sus cinco hijos. La seora Gesusa tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado Strongest de la zona de Cotahuma y su esposo trabaja como constructor. El crdito solicitado ser destinado a la construccin de una habitacin en obra fina, que ser destinada a dormitorio para sus hijos. Esta es la cuarta ocasin que solicita un prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito. Ella es cliente nuestro desde el ao 2005 y los crditos anteriores fueron pagados de acuerdo a los plazos establecidos.

loan.use: Build living space/dormitory for her children.

loan.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Mrs. Sofia V. lives in a house in antricretico (a special type of rental arrangement offered in Bolivia) in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. Sofia is retired from city of La Paz educational system.

Upon the conclusion of her lease, the owner of the home she lives in asked for an increase in the anticretico. Her request for a loan would be to pay this cost of living increase.

This is the first time she seeks a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis completed indicates that she qualifies favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Sofa V. vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona de Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz; Sofa es jubilada del magisterio urbano de la ciudad de La Paz. La duea de casa le solicit que le aumente el monto del anticretico, por cuanto el plazo del contrato ha concluido. Por lo que el crdito solicitado ser destinado al incremento del anticretico en el cual la seora Sofa reside. Esta es la primera ocasin que solicita un prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito.

loan.use: Payment toward increase in cost of living expenses/lease renewal for home.

loan.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titielewa E. is 35-years-old and a mother of two. Her family lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells loaves of bread. Mrs. E. has been in business since 2001 and requests a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional ingredients from which to bake bread and increase her sales inventory.

loan.use: To purchase ingredients for baking bread and increasing production

loan.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Mr. Luciano C. lives in the Alpacota section of the city of La Paz with his wife, Maria Capcha, and their three kids. Mr. Luciano works as a driver of a small truck transporting construction supplies. His wife works doing wash at individual homes.

With previous loans they were able to build approximately half of a perimeter wall, as well as two bedrooms. The credit they are currently seeking would be to finish the perimeter wall, and to demolish a bedroom made from adobe that is very old and deteriorated.

This will be his eighth loan, and the socioeconomic analysis completed indicates he qualifies favorably for access to credit. Luciano has been a client of ours since the year 2000 and has always paid back his loans satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El seor Luciano C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Alpacoma de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la seora Maria Capcha y sus tres hijos. El seor Luciano trabaja como chofer de una volqueta realizando el traslado de material de construccin y su esposa realiza el trabajo de lavandera en casas particulares. Con anteriores crditos realizaron la construccin de muro perimetral en un 50% y la conclusin de dos habitaciones en planta alta. El crdito solicitado ser destinado a la construccin de la totalidad del muro perimetral y la demolicin de una habitacin de adobe que por su antigedad se encuentra en total deterioro. Esta es la octava ocasin que solicita un prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito. Luciano es cliente nuestro desde el ao 2000 y siempre ha pagado sus crditos en forma satisfactoria.

loan.use: Construction of a perimeter wall and demolition of a deteriorated bedroom.

loan.name: Karen

texts.es:
Mrs. Karen R. lives in her parents home in the Llojeta section of the city of La Paz, along with her husband and their two children. She promotes cosmetic products and her husband works in a sporting goods store.

The rooms they occupy date back more than twenty years and the roof, due to age-related deterioration, is in disrepair and leaks when it rains.

The credit solicited would be earmarked to replace a roof and remodel the interior of one bedroom. This is the first occasion they seek a loan and the socioeconomic analysis completed indicates they qualify favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Karen R. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el seor Edson Espaa y sus dos hijos. La seora Karen es promotora de productos cosmticos y su esposo es empleado en una tienda de venta de artculos deportivos. Las habitaciones que ocupan datan de ms de veinte aos y los techos, debido al deterioro por su antigedad presentan fisuras que se traducen en filtraciones de agua cuando llueve. El crdito solicitado ser destinado al cambio de techos en una habitacin y la reparacin del revoque interior de la habitacin. Esta es la primera ocasin que solicita un prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito.

loan.use: Fix the roof and remodel the interior of one bedroom.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Planting rice crop.

loan.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Mrs. Griselda C. lives in the Alpacoma section of the city of La Paz, along with her husband and their two children. She runs a neighborhood store out of her home, and her husband works as a driver of a small truck transporting construction supplies.

The rooms they occupy are rented and their plot of land still has a foundation for an additional room. Their loan would be earmarked to building two rooms so they can move to a place of their own.

This is the third occasion that she seeks a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis conducted indicates they qualify favorably for access to credit. This will be the second time that Griselda solicits credit through Kiva. Her prior loan was paid in its entirety and without any delays.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Griselda C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Alpacoma ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el seor Francisco Cacasaca y sus dos hijos. La seora Griselda tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como chofer de una volqueta, transportando material de construccin. Las habitaciones que ocupan son de alquiler y su lote de terreno aun tiene amurallado y cimiento corrido para una habitacin. El crdito solicitado ser destinado a la construccin de dos habitaciones para as poder trasladarse a su vivienda propia. Esta es la tercera ocasin que solicita un prstamo y el anlisis socioeconmico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crdito. Esta ser la segunda vez que Griselda solicita crdito a travs de Kiva. El crdito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad sin ninguna demora.

loan.use: Construction of two rooms on their own land.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Invest in supplies.

loan.name: Maura's Group

texts.en:
Asenciona, Martha, and Maura are members of the Aleli community bank. Asenciona has been a member for five years, while Martha and Maura joined one year ago. In their community bank, they have learned to be responsible, punctual, learned how to invest in their businesses, and to save.

Asenciona is 55 years old. She is married and has nine children, two of whom live with her. Asenciona sells food staples, such as flour, rice and sugar. In addition, she sells fruits and vegetables from her home. With the help of her children, Asenciona has been working in this area for several years.

Martha is 58 years old. She is married and has six children, only one of whom is still living with her. Martha and her daughter sell clothing to friends and family. They bring the clothes from the cities of Lima and Tacna. In addition, Martha owns a motorcycle taxi that she rents to her son.

Maura is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. For the past six months, Maura has been selling food at the main bus stop in Ayacucho. In addition, Maura travels to the jungle region once every two weeks, where she buys fish and vegetables to resell in Ayacucho.

Asenciona, Martha, and Maura need loans of 400, 400, and 600 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy milk, oil, sugar, rice, fruit, fish, and vegetables.

One of the important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earnings savings account that each associate has. Asenciona, Martha, and Maura plan to use their savings to pay for their childrens education and to increase the capital available to their businesses. Their dreams are to own their own home, buy a motorcycle taxi, and that their children will be professionals.

loan.use: Asenciona, Martha, and Maura need loans of 400, 400, and 600 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy milk, oil, sugar, rice, fruit, fish, and vegetables.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Farming/agricultural supplies.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Planting rice crop.

loan.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu L. is 40-years-old and a mother of four children. Her family lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1995, she has been selling paper waste that is recycled into tissue paper. Her loan request of $450 will allow her to purchase more paper waste and increase her sales.

loan.use: To purchase paper waste for resale to a tissue paper manufacturer

loan.name: Clemencia's Group

texts.en:
Maura, Doris and Clemencia are part of the Aleli community bank. Maura and Clemencia have been members for four years, and Doris has been a member for six years. In their community bank, they have learned to save and to work efficiently.

Maura is 58 years old. She is married and has eight children. Maura sells candies and fruit at the Abelardo Quinez school in the San Juan Bautista neighborhood of Ayacucho. Her son, who is a student at this high school, helps her.

Doris is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Doris has a store where she sells food staples, such as rice, flour, and sugar, as well as fruits and vegetables. She started her business several years ago with very little capital, and it has grown considerably.

Clemencia is 35 years old. She is married and has four children. Clemencia makes chocolates. She uses a traditional Ayacuchan method using cocoa, sugar, and cinnamon. She sells her products in the open-air markets and stores of Ayacucho. In addition, with the help of her children, she travels to the provinces to sell her products there.

Maura, Doris and Clemencia need loans of 600, 800, and 400 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in soft drinks, oranges, mandarins, bananas, fuel, beer, pasta, cocoa, and sugar.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning-savings account that each associate has. Maura, Doris and Clemencia plan to use their savings to pay for their childrens schools and to improve their businesses. Their dreams are that their children will be professionals, their businesses will continue to grow, and they will continue to move forward.

loan.use: Maura, Doris and Clemencia need loans of 600, 800, and 400 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying soft drinks, oranges, mandarins, bananas, fuel, beer, pasta, cocoa, and sugar.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Invest in his rice crop/harvest.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Invest in planting of rice crop.
